Detailed Description

A class that shows items in a center-locked, horizontally scrolling list.

When using Gallery, should set the items for gallery provider which want to show on Gallery.

The following is a simple example for Gallery.

We must add resource array for pictures which will be displayed on Gallery: 

 Vector<int> mpImgVector;
 mpImgVector.append(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a01);
 mpImgVector.append(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a02);
 mpImgVector.append(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a03);
 mpImgVector.append(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a04);
 mpImgVector.append(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a05);
 mpImgVector.append(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a06);
 mpImgVector.append(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a07);
 mpImgVector.append(SDKWidgetTest::R::drawable::a08);

Before we create Gallery, we need to implement our own ItemProvider, and override getItemWidget and createItemWidget function:

 class MyGalleryProvider: public ItemProvider {

 Vector<int> mpResSet; //member variable to point strings.
 Page *mpPage;

 const static int32_t msImageWidgetId = 1;

 public:
     MyGalleryProvider(Vector<int> &res, Page *page)
         : pResSet(res), mpPage(page) {
     }

     Widget *createItemWidget(int32_t index) {

       ImageWidget *pImg = new ImageWidget(mpPage);
       pImg->setId(msImageWidgetId);

       LinearController *pCtrl = new LinearController(mpPage);
       LinearControllerParams* mplcp1 = new LinearControllerParams(300, 350);

       pCtrl->addWidget(pImg, mplcp1);
       return pCtrl;
     }

     Widget *getItemWidget(int32_t position,
           gaia::core::Widget *pItemWidget, gaia::core::Widget *pParent) {
       LinearController *pCtrl = static_cast<LinearController *>(pItemWidget);

       ImageWidget *pImg =
           static_cast<ImageWidget *>(pCtrl->findWidgetById(msImageWidgetId));

       pImg->setImageResource(mpResSet[position]);
       pImg->setScaleType(ImageWidget::FIT_XY);

       return pItemWidget;
     }
 };

After implement our own provider, we can start to create Gallery and show in Page: 

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence *savedInstanceState) {

     Scene* mpScene = Scene::SceneFactory(static_cast<Page*>(this));

     // Create a Gallery instance.
     Gallery *mpGallery = new Gallery(static_cast<Page*>(this));

     // Create a gallery provider which contents you want show on Gallery.
     MyGalleryProvider *mpProvider = new MyGalleryProvider(mpImgVector, this);

     // Set picture content in provider into Gallery.
     mpGallery->setItemProvider(mpProvider);

     // Sets the currently selected item on Screen.
     mpGallery->setSelection(5);

     // Sets the spacing between items.
     mpGallery->setSpacing(50);

     LinearController *pController = new LinearController(this);
     pController->addWidget(mpGallery);

     mpScene->attachController(pController);
     mpScene->setupSceneLayout();
 }

virtual bool gaia::ui::Gallery::onFling ( const gaia::core::MotionEvent &  e1,
const gaia::core::MotionEvent &  e2,
float  velocityX,
float  velocityY 
) [virtual]

Notified of a fling event when it occurs with the initial on down MotionEvent and the matching up MotionEvent.

The calculated velocity is supplied along the x and y axis in pixels per second.

Parameters:
e1The first down motion event that started the fling.
e2The move motion event that triggered the current onFling.
velocityXThe velocity of this fling measured in pixels per second along the x axis.
velocityYThe velocity of this fling measured in pixels per second along the y axis.
Returns:
true if the event is consumed, else false
